metadata.title: Convert Kilohertz to Megahertz – Frequency Converter
metadata.description: Convert frequency from Kilohertz (kHz) to Megahertz (MHz), useful for radio and electronic specifications.

introduction: This converter transforms frequency measurements from Kilohertz to Megahertz, enabling frequency range understanding.
Radio frequencies, broadcasting, and electronics are specified across kilohertz to megahertz to gigahertz ranges.
This converter uses the standard relationship where 1 megahertz equals exactly 1,000 kilohertz.
methodology: 1 MHz = 1,000 kHz. To convert kilohertz to megahertz, divide by 1,000. For example, 1,000 kHz = 1 MHz, 88,000 kHz = 88 MHz.
Radio stations are identified by frequency in megahertz (FM 88.5) while some technical specs use kilohertz.
Understanding frequency conversion is essential for electronics and radio applications.
This converter provides precise frequency conversions.
examples: Example 2 – Electronics: A 500 kHz oscillator = 0.5 MHz.
Example 3 – Communication: A 2.4 GHz WiFi frequency = 2,400 MHz = 2,400,000 kHz.

faqs.question: What is the conversion from Kilohertz to Megahertz?
faqs.answer: 1 MHz = 1,000 kHz. Divide kilohertz by 1,000 to get megahertz.

faqs.question: What is the FM radio frequency range?
What is a hertz?
faqs.answer: 1 Hertz (Hz) = 1 cycle per second. 1 kHz = 1,000 Hz. 1 MHz = 1,000,000 Hz.

glossary.definition: Frequency unit equal to 1,000 hertz or cycles per second.
Frequency unit equal to 1,000,000 hertz or 1,000 kilohertz.
